title: Must visit place Near Lansdowne
review: It takes around 1-2 hours to reach here from Lansdowne.

title: Beautiful
review: It's 37kms from landsdowne.Scenic beauty of mountains and valleys while driving there.Apart from few bad patches, road is good.parking is available.

title: Mahadev temple
review: A popular local saying is that you should must visit Tarkeshwar Mahadev temple approx 32 kms from Lansdowne .

title: Must place to visit if you visit Lansdowne.
review: This place is around 40 Km away from Lansdowne. However there is so much calm and peace in that place and you feel like spending whole day. I would recommend this place as must visit place.

title: An awesome place to get spiritually recharged
review: The one day journey from Delhi was worth it .

title: temple with scenic beauty
review: I went to Mid January'19. It is 36 KM away from lensdowne. There is parking space for car. There is 300 meter trek from parking to  temple. This place has very good scenic beauty. This temple is 1500 years old and has very important significance.

title: Om Namah Shivay!
review: Takes about 1.5 hours of drive to reach this place from Lansdowne. The temple is nearly 300 meter from the parking. However, the walk gives feel of nature walk so its worth driving that far and walking a bit. It goes without saying that any Shiva temple fills you with eternal peace and this one is no exception and especially given the location and surroundings, you are all the more tempted to just sit and soak in the beauty of the place! Must visit when in Lansdowne!

title: Its just like another temple
review: It is just like any other temple, nothing extra ordinary, however one can visit there while roaming around in lansdowne

title: Must Visitable Place Tarkeshwar Mahadev Temple
review: Interesting place. Amazing place with a soothing effect . Burans flowers makes it more beautiful . It feels like you r in lap of nature . Roads are above average , only in few places u find glitches but when u reach there trust me you will gonna find yourself very Comfortable . Must visitable once. Enjoyed peace of the place.

title: Must Visit to this Temple to get recharge spirituality
review: Very beautiful place ... MUST VISIT. 35 KM from City Centre , but will take 2 hrs for normal drive due to narrow and steep curvy road. But coo, and fresh air make you active through out.

title: Spirituality in the Jungle
review: This temple is located so deep in the jungle that not everyone will be able to guess its beauty. Clad with the charming sound of hundreds of bells, this place is a must visit - a place where you can spend whole of your day

title: The place itself makes you religious
review: It was a good drive from lansdown. The road is mysty and bit narrow but well built. Be careful from local passenger vehicles.  The temple is within a valley full of old trees. Very peaceful. The Temple ia of Mahdev and Maataji. We reached arond 1:30 PM the main temple was closed at that time. But it was indeed a good experience overall. The place is not much covered by commob tourists yet.

title: Visit this temple!
review: Beautiful temple in a meadow in the forest. Peaceful, calm, clean and not crowded. Be

title: A place to visit
review: It is one of the best place to visit around Lansdowne.  Temple is surrounded by Deodar trees and calm atmosphere which also favours it as a best meditation place.

title: Serene and mysterious
review: This is only for people who love exploring offbeat places or are super religious. We (my wife and I) are bit of both. So, when the daughter and her colony friend were still asleep, we drove down to the location from the hotel guided local signboards as Google baba had no clue.

title: Tarkeshwar mahadev mandir
review: 1500 years old temple, surrounded by beautiful sceneries..approx. 1 hour drive from Lansdowne.

title: Pure Bliss
review: Blissful place, one needs to visit this temple to immerse in the spiritual vibrations that reverberate through out. Especially the followers of Lord Shiva.

title: Peace and calm
review: A place of worship cannot be reviewed. But still, I would add a few lines for this place. This temple is situated at a distance of 35 kms from Lansdowne and is almost an hour's drive. Start early after breakfast as there are only a few eateries on the way. An early start might help in getting a parking space as the same is small. From the parking area the temple is at five minutes walking distance. The walk contains both uphill and downhill track and the same can be tiring. The Temple is surrounded by an ashram and jungle area and offers great view for taking pictures. It's the only place in Lansdowne, I would recommend as must visit. The drive to the temple and the place itself has a calming effect. Take blessings of Baba and enjoy the location.

title: Tarakeswar Mahadev
review: Really a place near to almighty..serene clean and beautiful.. near to Lansdowne. Just 40 k.m. from Lansdowne. You have to go down just 200 metres which is not very stiffer climb or down ...

title: Temle of Shiva in Serene environment
review: An adventurous journey has to be undertaken before you reach this place . You have to motor down in a hill area and walk up and down to reach and come back . Whole journey can be tiring . Once you reach there you love the calm and peaceful environmenand get blessed by Lord Shiva . A must visit for those who love adventure and peaceful places.

title: Religious Place
review: A powerful temple, you feel something different here. It has a aura around it that it make you feel a calm

title: Beautiful and Serene
review: The temple is round 37 km from Lansdowne.  The road leading to the temple is pretty good with very less traffic.  A must visit for devotees and to spend quality time.

title: Serene and Mystic - Blissed to the soul
review: Well this is place is one full of peace and mystic force. Surrounded by nature, away from Human habitat, but yet so relaxing and peaceful. There is some divine force at this Temple which u can feel straight away... Must visit for people coming to Lansdowne... Though the journey from Lansdowne to this place is 1.15 hours (including the small "trek"), but It is worth it.....

title: Awesome Place
review: Visited Tarkeshwar Mahadev Temple. Very awesome place to go anytime you are free. The ambiance here is great. Here, there is absolute silence. This is very cold and calm place even when the weather in the plane is dearly hot. This place is surrounded by trees all around. The way to reach this temple is very good and a lot of mountains come in the way. And the view there in the way is just awesome. The temple is simply awesome surrounded by trees all around. This place is cold. Must visit destination for nature lovers and religious people. Spent very refreshing time.

title: Tarkeshwar Mahadev Temple
review: Tarkeshwar Mahadev Temple is located in a beautiful surroundings of Cedar & Pine Trees. It is just 37 kilometers away from beautiful Hill Resort and Cantonment called Lansdowne. This place is known for famous Shiva Temple. This is an ideal place for peace and nature lovers as well.

title: Beautiful location
review: This temple is located bit far from main Lansdowne but the way to reach this temple & location of temple is really good.

title: Excellent experience
review: The Temple is in middle of the mountains and jungle. The approach road is bit tricky but enjoyable. Go there with some time in hand so that you can spend some good time and enjoy the mountains and the jungle.

title: Place not to miss in Lansdowne
review: Located around 40 Kms from Lansdowne between tall pine trees and amidst nature that will glue in your mind. Awesome drive in between clouds - priceless.

title: A must visit place
review: This ancient temple is located in deep in the valley surrounded by pine trees all around. It is a very peaceful, religious place and one must visit here and spend some time to breath the fresh air.

title: Positive Vibes
review: Good , calm place...must visit...temple in the middle of forest...big big trees and tree in trishul shape...

title: Divine
review: Divine place (Tapowan) surrounded by Natural Beauty & peace every one has to vist that place if you are in Lansdowne

title: Peaceful visit to lansdowne
review: It is an 1600 year old temple and at an 1800 mtr height. It was 35 kmnfrom our hotel and road towards it route are not so straight forward. It has lot of turning and if people are having vomit sickness than do think before going to it. Rest u will feel very good and peace their.

title: Nice place amidst nature
review: Nothing great but location is awesome. Most of the people seemed to use it as a family picnic spot. Road leading to this place is scarry and in bad condition

title: an amazing ambience
review: the trip to lansdowne is incomplete without being to tarkeshwar mahadev temple. the scenic beauty is amazing. the ambience there will refresh you to core. temperatures are comforting there throughout the year and lush green surroundings with sounds of temple bells will give you spiritual as well as scenic pleasure. Must go place for those going to Lansdowne.

title: Soul relaxing location
review: Recently visited the site. The Location of the tarkeshwar mandir is  excellent. It is situated in a valley amongst the high rise trees. The mandir is not very big but is a must visit place religiously and for soul relaxing purpose. It is about 35 km from main Lansdowne town. Beautiful place.

title: Religious place approaching your spritiual senses
review: Tarkeshwar Mahadev temple is a quiet small temple located in the midst of heavy trees. You feel as if you have actually reached the abode of Lord Shiva!

title: Great place to visit!!!
review: While travelling to Lansdowne , this is much talked about place . Tarkeshwar mahadev is very religious place. It is about 35 kms away from Lansdowne. Temple is situated in mid of beautiful jungle.. Area is very clean and green.

title: Must go
review: Great place to visit. The route is beautiful. There are many picturesque location and temple arena itself is gorgeous

title: Peaceful, serene, beautiful
review: Peaceful, serene, tranquil, calm, placid, still and quite place. Worth going if u go to lansdowne. Bout 35 km beautiful drive from lansdowne. Scenic beauty all along the drive.

title: Good Place
review: Serene and great place to find peace among the hills.

title: What a Beauty!
review: If you need to visit a place where you can find your lost inner peace, Tarkeshwar Mahadev Temple is the place to visit.

title: Nice temple
review: Tarkeshwar mandir is around 50 km from Lansdowne. I visit there with my friends. Location was nice. Temple is very beautiful. Nice one must visit

title: Must Visit. The heart of Lansdowne
review: The path has a lot of steep turns. For all those who have car sickness, better be ready with adequate medicines.

title: In the midst of nature
review: The temple is located on a hill and is covered by pine forests on all sides which adds to the beauty of this place.

title: Beautiful old temple
review: One of the few places to visit in a Lansdowne trip. It requires some walking. Down a bit from the parking area, coming back is the strenuous part. But the huge trees (Deodar I guess) and the abundance of them is a visual treat.

title: Ritual experience
review: This is one of the most ancient temples in West Bengal. It is a very good place to offer homage to Lord Shiva. Pilgrims come here from several parts of the state & the country. Hotels & guesthouses are also available here.

title: Good place for religious point of view
review: Good place for the religious point of view otherwise it is quite far away- around 40 kms so may not worth to travel in the hilly terrain.

title: Serene place
review: This temple is around 30 km from the Lansdowne city market. This temple is dedicated to Lord tarkeshwar. It is a part of the Shiva trinity and represents Akash (The other two being Hatkeshwar in Vadnagar representing Patal and Mahakaleshwar in Ujjain representing Dharti). This temple DOESN'T HAVE a shivaling instead it has a swayambhu Idol of Lord Shiva. The idol is placed on a platform above ground to represent it is above ground i.e in sky.

title: Majestic Tarkeshwar
review: An exceptionally brilliant and peaceful place with magnetic charm for holiness. No pandas and any kind of commercial people around . No good quality hotels around and makeshift restaurants serving knick knacks like Maggie are available. Must visit place if holiness attracts one , nothing much available for children except running around in open glades of grass . Majestic indeed.

title: Heavenly Place
review: The temple is situated at around 35 kms away from Lansdowne area. The road to temple is mostly hilly terrain with some repair patches. There is open parking available outside temple. And it is half km away from parking area.

title: Visit this temple!
review: Beautiful temple in a meadow in the forest. Peaceful, calm, clean and not crowded. Be wary of the cows, they will eat your lunch even if you don’t want to share it!

title: Peaceful and beautiful
review: Beautiful temple located in mountain valley surrounded by tall trees giving a beautiful landscape to the area. Very calm and peaceful.

title: Good scenic beauty and nice temple
review: This place is around 34 kms from Lansdowne and entire route is hilly.Last 4 kms stretch is not good but its manageable.Its a small ancient Lord Shiva temple. Beautiful temple surrounded by hills and tall and lush green deodar trees. Amazing view. After parking your vehicle, u need walk down for around 900mts. At parking place you can get maggi and tea.

title: mesmerizing and quiet!
review: its a must visit for the beauty and the divinity of the place.

title: Serene and silent place to visit amongst mountains
review: Temple is located at the lap of mountains. This place is accessible from Lansdowne and one need to be cautious while driving at the last stretch while reaching the temple. The deodar trees are mesmerizing and the location is also good for photography. The temple is very small and is very silent.

title: Wonderful place
review: Worth visiting the old temple in dense forest of Devadar trees. Temple is situated in valley. There are many small bells in the way to temples with different octaves and gives pleasant sound.

title: Calm serene
review: Calm and serene place. U feel as if you are not in this world. Very tall trees of deodhar.way down to the temple is steep.

title: Must visit
review: This temple is located around 40km from Lansdowne. You have to walk around 200mts on a cemented downhill path from the parking to reach the temple. It is situated in the middle of a forest with big deodar trees. The entire area is well maintained and there is also an ashram where you can stay (094583 75526).

title: Good combination of spirituality and nature.
review: Excellent location of temple amidst Deodar trees. The only issue is parking. If you are self driving then be ready for parking adventure near to temple or else you need to park 2km before.

title: Nature and Belief
review: Beautiful place surrounded with pine and cedar tress . I would suggest to experience the beautiful view while going to this place. You will get picturesque scenery. We actually stopped our bike and enjoyed the sun set, the scenic beauty of the mountains and also the roads.

title: Trip to Lansdowne
review: Excellent....serene spirituality in nature's lap...a little offbeat and not so commercialized place which happens to be the best part

title: Peaceful and calm....
review: The first thoughts which come to mind are Peaceful and calm .... surrounded by trees, this temple is a must go. Pray at the temple and then one can spend endless hours soaking in the ambiance. The greenery all around, the cold air, chirping of the birds, chants from the temple ... all make this place a must go.

title: Peaceful place in lap of mother nature
review: The temple is situated at a distance of around 33 kms from Lansdowne. The drive is mainly smooth, only the last stretch of 5kms road is little bumpy. But it's all worthy when you reach there. Where you park your car, it's around 300 m walk  between the long trees and there is the temple at the centre of the valley, surrounded by long trees. This peaceful environment with so much greenery will make you fall in love with mother nature.

title: Peaceful and beautiful place to meditate and self realization
review: Its a small ancient Lord Shiva temple 33 kms away from Lansdowne. As the there are not many attraction points in Lansdowne , this should be planned for sure.

title: One of the most sacred and peaceful place in Uttarakhand.
review: Temple is around 30-35 km from main lansdowne. Roads are smooth with scenic views. You will experience some turbulence in last 5 km stretch due to rough patches on the roads. But once you reach there, you will find the place worth it. It is like heaven. You will not find any crowd if you visit on week days. A small temple of Mahadev is surrounded by big devdar trees. You will not find devdar trees anywhere outside temple territory of around 300m. All you find is only pine trees. It is not a big temple as you are expecting. Its a small temple surrounded by lush green vegetation. If you are a party freak, I will not recommend you this place. But if you know the value of your inner soul, just go and get closer to your soul. Spend some time there and you will get refreshed. It is one of the best place to meditate. But if you are first time traveler, do pack your food along with you, you will not get any restaurant near by. I will strongly recommend this sacred place for nature lovers, disciples of god and everyone who's looking for peace. There is no hotel in vicinity. But 'The Rock heaven and The tiger resort' are the hotel near to this place. I will recommend The Rock Heaven which is around 15 km from Mahadev temple.

title: Blessings from lord Shiva
review: The temple is situated in the Pauri district of Uttarakhand, India. This is nearly 290 kilometers from Delhi. The route to be taken is Delhi-Meerut-Kotdwar-Duggada-Lansdowne-Tarkeshwar Temple. Just before Lansdowne there is a diversion that is required to be taken. The last few kilometers are little uneasy as the road gets narrow with tight turns. From Kotdwar the natural curves welcomes you with the beautiful sights of the valleys and rivers you come across. As you go higher the temperature drops and you can see the beautiful road making its way through the alpine forest. Once you reach the temple you can feel the calmness. The temple is dedicated to lord Shiva. The temple is surrounded by cedar and pine forest. There is a Dharamshala available and with advance information about your visit you can stay at the dharamshala.

title: avoid if suffers from nausea, otherwise good for nature lovers
review: Temple is surrounded with large deodar trees and very nice to enjoy greenery and nature. Difficult road to reach, having lots of curves. had to take lot of breaks to avoid vommiting.

title: Wish I could stay here for ever
review: The tall and lush green deodar trees makes this a picturesque location. Serene and Tranquil location maintaining the virgin nature.

title: Never miss this
review: The abode of Lord Tarkeshwar, in the deep and thick the cedar forest is just amazing. You need around 3 and half hours in total (journey and stay) from lansdowne to visit this place. But once you reach there you will love walking though the the thick cedar forest. It is must visit place

title: Tranquil place
review: What a amazing experience after visiting this real divine place.. Tranquility all-around the temple situated amid thick deodar jungle..We really felt rejuvenated after offering prayers here..

title: Picturques place
review: Must visit this place and relax for few hours to be with GOD and Nature.. Meditate for some time and rejuvenate yourself..

title: Must visit place
review: If you come to Lansdowne, and skips Tarkeshwar Temple, you're doing a sin! Literally.

title: Beyond Imagination
review: Surrounded by Devdar Trees this place is heaven for nature lovers. This is 1500 years old temple so very historical and religious.Mesmerizing view.Quiet and clam place .Only problem is State Buses parked on the way to temple which become the cause of pollution and jam.Somebody should make sure that buses and tempo travelers are parked properly.

title: Tarkeshwar Mahadev visit
review: Devine experience in lap of natural beauty  - 38kms from Lansdowne. Temple dedicated to Lord Shiva. There's a small guest house/ashram to stay. Can visit from Lansdowne/Kotdwara. Taxi share jeep available from both.

title: Beautiful
review: The location is amazing, and has got a beautiful view of jungle.

title: Must visit
review: Travelling to the temple is one of the best experiences of our stay in Lansdowne. This is also the best attraction of the trip.

title: The Serene powerful majestic place near lansdowne
review: Its bliss to be at this temple of Mahadev- Tadkeshwar. It is at quite some altitude and has a thick growth of tall deodar trees all around, giving it a unique mystic blissful feeling. It is quite peaceful and there is a definite sense of it being a majestic place fit for god. Do, not be fooled by 34 KM tag from Landsowne, the ride is slow and through the serpentine winding roads. It takes time.. but it is ABSOLUTELY WORTH IT

title: Serene beauty
review: This is a myst visit. Slightly far away but worth the effort. The location is awesome. Clicks at this place will make ur trip

title: Awesome
review: Drive from Lansdowne is 35 km but awesome. The temple itself is awesome. Must visit. Really beautiful location.

title: A wow experience
review: 40 km from Lansdowne, this temple is a hidden gem in the wilderness. Located in the heart of the forest, Tarakeshwar temple is surrounded by lush greenery and is such a peaceful place. With very humble infra, the temple has a mystical charm and calm ambiance. One of the trees inside the premises has the shape of Trishul which is believed to be of the God.  This sacred tree is also worshiped. Exit the temple and take a walk in the surrounding jungle to view the beauty around. One of the best things that I saw was, no trees were axed. Those which fell naturally, still lie there, untouched, undisturbed. The balance of nature has not been disturbed.

title: OM NAMAH SHIVAY
review: it's just 314 km from Delhi,  just 4 km before lansdowne take right to Tarkeshwar it's 35 km from there. We stayed in Camp chayan 12 kms before temple and it's nice tent accomodation with helpful staff and good food.  Now the temple is nestled deep down in deodar forest and once you reach,  you will feel only one thing that is euphoria of peace.  It's unforgettable for me just stay there for an hour and 2 and meditate,  you will just feel charged with positivity.  JAI BHOLENATH

title: Positive Vibes
review: It is around 40 km drive between Lansdowne and Temple and is very beautiful and scenic. Amazing experience when we show temple surrounded by mountains from all sides.  You need to track for 10 mins to reach inside the temple but once you reach it will feel like you are in heaven

title: Peaceful place
review: Very nice and peaceful place..  Nice beauty and environment was awesome...  It's called Tarkeswar Temple lord Shiva ji..  Must visit again as soon as possible

title: No 1 location near lansdowne
review: Approximately 1 hr drive from hotel, Its ancient shiva temple and location is  excellent, must visit place.

title: Very peaceful Temple stunning scenery enroute
review: We were suggested by Mr Ajay from the Homestay to surely visit the temple, initially we were a bit sceptical as this temple is 35 kms from lansdowne but finally we decided that we must go and this was our best decision as this place is truly a hidden gem, the drive going upto the temple is beautiful and very scenic, when we finally reached there is a 300 meter walk downhill which is very pretty and there are 3 trees in the vicinity of the temple that depict the trishul as they have three stems that make them look like a trident. A must visit place.

title: Divine experience
review: Very good place, roads are good but very narrow. Carefully drive to the location. People who cant walk long must not attempt as it is a bit of up hill

title: slience & Peace which gives you inner strength
review: its about 35 KM from main Lansdowne city, but a worth travel and must visit.

title: PEACFUL TEMPLE
review: When v visited no one was there . Lot of Monkey be care full.

title: Temple Dedicated to Lord Shiva
review: The drive was long but the road was good and smooth so we didn't feel the distance. The temple is at the dead-end of the road and after parking your vehicle, you need to walk down the steps to reach to a big flat ground where the temple is situated. The area is peaceful and calm. They have strict policy on sitting in the lawns, so as to avoid people doing any sort of picnic activities over there. We were surprised to note that unlike other mountain temples, there were No Monkeys..!!

title: Amazing view
review: The place is very quiet amidst nature. The short walk to the temple feels nice. The sorrounding area ia also very peaceful.A must visit if in the vicinity of lansdowne.

title: Beautiful temple
review: It is a beautiful temple in a beautiful location. When we visited the weather was so awesome there were clouds everywhere. A must visit

title: Exotic Feeling
review: This temple of Lord Mahadev is situated in the serene atmosphere amond Deodhar Trees lined up on all sides of the temple. Worth visiting once in alifetime to enjoy the scenic beauty of the place alongwith the serenity of the temple.

title: Bhakti in the lap of nature
review: Pristine beauty and enchanting surrounding make you yearn for more.. when we reached there just few mins back there was rainfall and that made the surrounding even more mesmerising.. most importantly there was crowd but that did not affect the temple premises and they were very clean (an unlikely thing mostly in India).. the surroundings offer your great opportunities to feel at peace with yourself and you can take a silent walk with your near and dear onces and be enchanted with the not so distant sound of the the temple bells..

title: Very beautifully located temple
review: The temple is comfortably located between pine trees. The route has got some beautiful and dangerous view of the valley below.

title: Spritual place worth visit
review: this place is around 35 km from the Lansdowne. It take around one and half hour to reach this place and drive is typical hilly drive with lot of frequent turns. So people will hills syndrome are bound of have a difficult time during driving but once you reach the temple you will certainly forget all that bad experience. Nice spiritual place in the mid of nature beauty place belong to lord shiva.

title: Temple within a valley with so much positive energy
review: If you like to experience the drive in a valley, this is a must do!

title: Must visit!!
review: spiritual place of lord shiva... full of gods energy particles

title: Classic Bollywood Feel!
review: Okay we had actually reached Lansdowne to celebrate my birthday. And i feel thankful to my friends for everything. This place takes you back to the era of classic bollywood movies one can enjoy singing and running between as tall as beautiful deodar trees. The place is peaceful, clean and sacred for its reasons. If you are around Kotdwara or Lansdowne, i would say you must go there too. Thank me later.

title: tarkeshwar temple
review: A divine pearl amidst the dense forest of Deodar trees ,and is lively by the God's own army of monkeys & langoors.Tarkeshwar temple is a must visit place for all the nature lovers ,situated approx 35 km from lansdowne

title: Excellent
review: Excellent Scenic view. Its about 75mins drive from Lansdowne. Beautiful place with pine trees around. We took cab from main market, they ask for 1400-1200/-, finally agreed for 1000/-. Spend 2-3hrs once you reach there to enjoy the nature.

title: Worth the Long drive
review: Very serene and peaceful place. Probably the best thing to do if you are in lansdowne.

title: Worth the Drive
review: With hardly any people, among the forest, you will find the perfect spot for conversations and satisfaction with peace.

title: Keep your date with this temple and the wonderful trees surrounding it.
review: The location of this temple in a forest is magical. while you walk to the temple enjoy the woods, the lovely forests and clean out your lungs.  When you visit this temple, make it a point to look up at the trees above the main temple. The one directly above the temple has a magical trident at the top a Hindu symbol.  NO other trees grow this way just this one. If you decided to spend time in this area there is a lovely Swami Rama ashram. If you qualify, there is clean basic accommodation and very good vegetarian food. The costs are nominal, and there is a possibility of salvation!

title: scenic beauty
review: Very calm and quite temple. Very clean. Visitor must use the way from parking. Otherwise there are too many stairs. You can go with your shows upto front of the temple. No tout at all.

title: Nice place to visit
review: Long Journey from Hotel start early and spend more time in Temple. Take a break if you tired and see many beautiful views. Best season to visit may be just start of summer and rainy season also.

title: WORTH a Visit
review: This is amazing temple. Very old & picturesque. Must look for Natural Trishul made by Deodar trees behing the back of the temple. I have enclosed the picture. The place is extremely peaceful & worth visiting.

title: The most awesome place and very divine!
review: first of all the way to this place is really very scenic, and then this place, Oh! I am short of words to explain the divinely experience that you get here. If have not visited this place, your trip to Lansdowne is incomplete. However yes, visiting this place from lansdowne and back, would take around 5-6 hrs. so, please plan accordingly!

title: Couple
review: It is stated 1500 year old Mahadev Mandir. Very good location. Roads are bumpy and  zigzag which is usual in terrain. Very peaceful Mandir one can spent half day there.

title: Must visit
review: Great drive to the temple from Lansdowne and the walk from parking to the temple is a walk through nature with tall trees and the temperature drops along the way.

title: Great location
review: The feeling of peace is felt the moment you step in. The temple is very well maintained and retains the natural look. Must visit.

title: Out of this world!!!
review: The drive to this quaint little temple is beautiful and the scenery to die for...once here it's like u r in a different world altogether..it's so peaceful and serene..the tall deodar trees all around are majestic and yeah do not miss the special tree right next to the temple entrance..ask the pandit about it..

title: Far, but A Must Visit
review: This is a very scenic place. Though the temple is not big, but the location is awesome. It is peaceful and fully surrounded by Huge trees with sunlight stealing inside.

title: One of the oldest temple .
review: Overall view was very interesting , though it is not so close from the resort .Still we enjoyed the drive and clicked photos of nature .

title: Serene and peaceful!
review: Plan your trip in a way that you will get couple of hours to spend here.  lot of free space around in Deonar forest! Though there are steps and proper walkway, its difficult walk so advisable that people with mobility issues should avoid and there is nothing to do in parking so please stay at room.

title: Tapkeshwar The shiv Temple
review: It is a very religious place you can go there with family and you should spent some time there . In my opinion you should also stay there as well As they have few rooms in very cheap price .

title: Excellent Place.
review: Location is awesomely good, nice view on the way. amazing drive experience. May be one of the best place for driving experience.

title: Heavenly experience
review: Bit far from  Lansdown and  it's hill area to drive to it takes time but once you reach at the location of Tarkeswar Mahadev then it's unbelievable.

title: PEACE OF MIND
review: Very peaceful place surrounded by greenery, road to temple is okay not that bad or narrow as I read in some of the reviews.

title: A temple between a valley
review: This temple is around 32 kms from lansdowne. At a very secluded place. Roads are good but the last 5 kms the road is really narrow. So need a good driver to take u there safely. This temple is famous for tying bells when one's wish is completed.

title: Peaceful Place must visit and stayed a night there
review: I stayed at Lansdowne on 31 oct.2016. Next day morning we planned this trip to Tarkeshwar Mahadev Temple. I already read the reviews at TripAdvisor and found that the road lead to Tarkeshwar was narrow and dengerous to drive. Hence i hired a Local driver who took rs. 400/- day for driving. The Temple is 34 Km. away from Lansdowne. The Last 5-6 Km. route was dengerous. So be sure to take a expert driver. The Temple is located at a very peaceful location surrounded by pine tress. This is a good place for Meditation. There are a few Dharamshalas/ Ashrams for stay. Next time whenever i will go i will definitely stay there for atleast a night. Nature lovers will definitely enjoy there.

title: Nice Temple
review: This is nice temple with beautiful views.you must see this place nice weather every time. A Holly place must visit with family.

title: Mesmerising
review: About 40 kms from lansdowne. Beyond words. Really divinised place this is. Trees, clean air, space, all transport you to the beyond.

title: Excellent place
review: Its an excellent place.  A must to-do when visiting Landsowne.  trek for about 500 meters down through Dense Deodar forest to reach this amazing place.

title: Good
review: Journal to temple is about 45 km from SB Mount and is bit tiring but once reached there the place is really cool calm & beautiful. It is surrounded by Long & beautiful Devdaar trees.

title: Best place near Lansdowne
review: A temple which is located around 35 kilometers far away from Lansdowne. Lord Shiva is the main deity of this temple. The elevation is 1700+ mtrs.

title: Devotional visit while in Landsdowne
review: A nice piece full place 34 kms from Landsdowne, even the roads are nice and not dangerous at all. At Hills driving has to be with patience only. 1500 yrs old temple for the deciple of Lord Shiva Tardkeshwar

title: Temple maintained by Nature
review: A beautiful temple maintained by nature as it is surrounded by big trees. An unexplored place. Temple with a scenic beauty

title: Amazingly beautiful and spiritual place
review: Serene and beautiful . Deodar trees, silence  and spirituality in the air have an amazingly calming effect . Must visit if you are visiting Lansdowne

title: Holy shrine of Tarkeshwar Mandir.
review: Never  anywhere one would see a cluster of Deodhar tress - a mini forest - surrounded by the Pine trees. It is amazing.

title: Worth a Visit
review: The temple is about 40 kilometres away from Lansdowne with a narrow road approaching it. Once you park your car, there is a short walk to the temple. What is beautiful about this place are the surroundings. Where the rest of the forest is pine and oak, the temple is surrounded by tall deodhar trees. A strange and interesting phenomenon. The whole experience infuses a sense of peace

title: Peace and serenity
review: The best part of yhe temple is the natural made trishul in one of the deodar trees.

title: must visit place
review: A small place surrounded by tall Devdars. About 45 kms from Lansdowne. Very peaceful, spiritual place. Must spend few hours. Full of bids like blue magpie and black headed jays. The best part is the drive from lansdowne to the temple through untouched/uninhabited lush green mountains.

title: nice temple
review: its a old and beautiful temple with lots of bells hanging all around the temple. there is also a ashram there but don't know what facilities they offer

title: Must visit
review: very serene and nice place. must visit and journey between lansdowne city and tarkeshwar , you will remember for life time.

title: Very good natural beauty
review: If not for the temple, simply go there for oxygen and natural beauty of trees around you. Very cleanly maintained and the best place to visit from Lansdowne. Don't miss the natural 'trishul' or fork above the Shiva temple.

title: excellent bike trip road
review: Tarkeshwar is in the midst of deep forest, we visited while on our way back from Lansdowne to Ghaziabad. It is approx 40 km one side, so the journey was a bit tiring 80 km to an fro we felt it when we reached Kotdwara (in my Lansdowne review i have mistakenly mentioned mentioned Kathgodam in place of Kotdwara, please excuse).

title: Nice Holy Site surrounded by thick and tall deodar trees
review: Located atop a hill at 2092 meters, Tarkeshwar Mahadev Temple is believed to be one of the ancient holy sites or Siddha Pitas dedicated to Lord Shiva. Surrounded by thick and tall deodar trees, this place is ideal for all who look for peace and solace.

title: Temple in the lap of nature
review: Visited Tarkeshwar Mahadev Temple on 4/9/2016. Awesome location, breathtaking view, fresh air etc. etc. you can find everything you want from nature during your visit to this temple. It's about 40 Kms from Lansdowne, since there is not much to do in Lansdowne, I suggest that this temple is must visit. You can have a nice view of valley during your travel this temple. Narrow roads so need to take care while driving. Temple is surrounded with pine trees..

title: Mesmorize
review: steep way to this temple but view is awesome....you can enjoy every minute there.....location is best...This is a only place to visit

title: nice view
review: well temple has a good view around it. for people enjoying quiteness a good place to be there during evening

title: Must visit
review: around 40 km from Lansdowne so you require around 3 hours to visit his place. 1500 years old temple surrounded by hill, ultimate peaceful place with scenic beauty. Way to temple from Lansdowne also full of scenic beauty.

title: Long way down
review: It was a long way down from the market area but the destination was worth the walk. A quiet temple with few visitors

title: Brilliant setting for a temple
review: Its a must do if you are in lansdowne - while its a bit remote and narrow approach roads, the visit was totally worth it. The setting and the last few metres walk to the temple are pure bliss and could be a scene from any world class nature walk / boardwalk from around the world.

title: Feel the nature's beauty
review: The Tarkeshwar Mahadev temple is a heaven for devotees as there is no crowd but last the last 5 kilometers of roads are not in good condition.

title: Excellent
review: Must see place in Lansdowne.Situated between huge devdhar Trees.ultimate picturesque view .little far from down town

title: A quiet mandir, deep within tall deodars
review: The journey to reach the mandir was quite adventurous for us! We were stuck in traffic jam for more than two hours because of a landslide. And again the road leading to the temple is quite narrow, it was scary at times.

title: Tarkeshwar Mahadev
review: Nice place to drive-in. All through the path in this season it is lush green everywhere. Its a awesome place, The Tarkeshwar Mahadev Temple.

title: Good place
review: good to visit this place...situated in serene natural beauty...though lansdowne has limited place to visit it is good one.

title: holy shrine
review: mesmerizing. quite a hike down from the car park with jungles on the side. the temple itself is peaceful and worth a visit, especially in view of the mythological significance

title: Peace.
review: This place is awesome. Positive wives all around.OM NAMAH SHIVAY.... One of the best temple of Lord Shiva............

title: quaint and serene
review: The temple has been made in the middle of Deodar jungle. It should be visited once if in Lansdowne. The location is very quaint and the aura is very spiritual. One can go and sit there for hours.

title: Serene holy place
review: Tarkeshwar Mahadev Temple is truly blessed. It involves a lot of climbing down among Devdar forest to reach the temple. No demands, no fuss. You feel the presense of Lord Shiva there. The climb back up seemed much shorter. There are benches along the way for people to rest, if needed. Really loved the experience.

title: Beautiful- Must Visit
review: Tarkeshwar Mahadev temple is a must visit for tourists visiting lansdowne/ gumkhal. The temple is located admist natural serene landscapes covered with tall pine/ chir/ deodar trees. Moreover the road journey to the temple is breathtaking and amazing. The drive from lansdowne of one and half hours will take you though sinusoidal roads, beautiful terrace cultivation greenaries, forest slopes and via clouds just gliding past you.

title: "Om Namah Shivay" - Just divine
review: This place is the best place in Lansdowne region. The tall Deodar trees and the beautiful surroundings will calm your soul and you will be closer to nature and Lord Mahadev like never before. You can literally feel that this place is divine and has some Godly presence. Tarkeshwar Mahadev is a must visit for religious people as well as nature lovers.

title: Temple in a Beautiful Place
review: Located around 30-40 KM from lansdowne .The road to the place are narrow and dangerous . Better to go in a Taxi than self driving .

title: Best beauty
review: Nothing can exceed the beauty of this place. The temple is situated in valley surrounded by iconic jungle view. 300-400 meter walk from parking takes visitor in lap of nature. The beauty of way to temple cant be described in words. A must visit.

title: What a place spritual and sceneric
review: As the name suggest it is a very ancient temple surrounded by Deodar trees , lush green and pictrous view are spell bounding.

title: Awesome
review: It is located at very good place. you should visit there once you visit lansdowne. The views on the way was awesome.

title: Such a mesmerising place, full of energy, willing to go again
review: People must visit there as we can see the historic things with natural beauty & most importantly the cleanliness of the area...

title: Peaceful place.
review: Must visit if you are a disciple of Lord Shiva. Ask locals for direction to this temple as it's not easy to find on your own or with the help of GPS.

title: Combo of Divine & Beauty
review: This place is simply out of world,ancient Lord  Shiva temple surrounded by   pine trees . We spent a lot of time in the neat & clean surroundings of the temple.

title: Beautiful temple in the Deodar trees
review: Must see temple. Special attraction is a tree situated right behing the Mahadev temple, which takes the shape of a Trishul at the top.

title: walk in the clouds
review: i was there with my friends we walked all the way from the lake to the tample.

title: Very old temple and very peaceful
review: Very old temple surrounded by devdar tree. Very beautiful locatioan and calm and peaceful place. Climate is so cool here due to devdar tree

title: Religious & Beautiful Temple
review: The small neat & clean temple . The surrounding of temple is very scenic. Surrounding  of Tall Chinar trees really compliment the temple. Excellent combination of religious & nature loving place

title: nice location
review: Vey scenic location and peaceful place. But need to travel approx. 35km from Lansdowne in the Hilly terrain.

title: Tarkeshwar Mahadev Temple
review: Hey Guys !!

title: WOW!!!!
review: If you are at Lansdowne this is the place should not miss. Stay for 2-3 hours and feel the beauty of the place. One of the best place I have ever seen.

title: Tarkeshwar the place of serenity
review: It's been a regular destination in our hometown visits to Lansdowne. The charm of the places and friendly temple priests makes you want to visit again.

title: BEAUTIFUL PLACE
review: Beautiful temple of lord shiva...The small neat & clean temple . The surrounding of temple is very nice.Tall deodar trees really compliment the temple.must visit this place.One of the best place I have ever seen.

title: Calm & quiet place
review: A serene place with nice drive. Well maintained & clean. Do look out for the Trishul shaped tree right behind the temple.

title: Beg,Borrow,Save or Earn but Visit this Place, Serne,Sceinic,Beautiful,Divine,Natural,Cool,Calm,Airy,Lush Green
review: This one is the real beauty, it takes time from Lansdowne to temple but the route is scenic and 5 kms stretch of the road is not smooth and have many pot holes, you need to drive carefully, parking too an issue but you will forget everything once you are here. you will fill God around you. this is the must visit place beg borrow or steal but visit the place.

title: Awsome temple
review: It's very ancient temple of Lord Shiva,where you will see Shiv ji prathima that too made on stone instead of shivling,this temple is approximately 36 km from landsdawn on another hill with same height in comparison with Lansdowne, surrounded by thick and long oak and pine trees, weather was awsome and pretty cool.

title: must visit place
review: one must visit this temple and out of the world experience . we spent whole day as it huge place to explore . ashram of swami rama  is a must. we had lunch .Thanks to TITU maharaj  who guided us well and during my stay in landsdowne 5 day stay we visited two day

title: Something special
review: Drove to this place on may 27 with family...around 40 km from Lansdowne..hilly curvy rroads but a seasoned driver from plains can still manage..definitely not for a new driver. This place has something special about it..the calmness and serenity in the environment makes it very very special. Must visit place if going to Lansdowne,the surroundings make driving a fun. Try eating at prince restaurant in sisaldi which is around 15 km and lies on the way to tarkeshwar temple...great simple food we ate pahadi dal which is a mix of various lentils and butter roti. The owner is a nice person with great hospitality.

title: Very Peace full place
review: It is really very peaceful place. Temple is in mid of  very long devdar trees. Very cool place. But if you are going by self drive then be carefull road is single road. Last 5 KM are really haunting.

title: Holi place to visit
review: located at the lap at the mother nature, really good place to visit with family and people having a desire to visit religious place

title: Very tiring but a good place to visit
review: We visited the palce after a long tireful journey but the tiredness went away. The palce is so serene and cool. Very picturesque...

title: Must visit
review: The route to temple from Lansdowne is beautiful. must visit. go to ashram above the temple, had amazing tea there.

title: Tarkeshwar Mahadev
review: Sidhoeeth Temple of Shiva Tarkeshwar Mahadev is situated near Lansdown Pauri Garhwal Uttarakhand. If you are planing to visit Lansdown, must visit Tarkeshwar Mahadev Temple and it is just 32 KM from Lansdown

title: Eternal Peace!!
review: The weather is awesome and you can feel a sense of peace within. The environment around the temple is divine and you can actually sit there and meditate. I reached in the morning and stayed there for 3-4 hours and enjoyed the serenity there..

title: Beautiful and Spiritual Place
review: This is a must visit place if you are in Lansdowne. Gives you a feeling of warmth, positivity and spirituality.

title: Har Har MahaDev
review: Must Visiting Place, 40 KM  from Lansdowne, 1:30 hrs+ travel time, Peaceful place, little tight on Parking.

title: A must visit if visiting to Lansdowne
review: We had a chance to visit this place which is 35 kms away from Lansdowne. The place is really good - a meadow in the jungle and temple in the serene surroundings. Did not feel like leaving the scenic ambiance.

title: Awesome location, beautiful panoramic view
review: Must visit for its amazing location (even if you do not believe in god). Beautiful place. Decent drive from Lansdowne

title: Nature's lap
review: Ravishing view and serenity. It is the place to visit to enjoy nature at its best. around 2 hours from the main town but worth the visit

title: Aged old temple
review: The Tarkeshwar Mahadev temple is situated at a distance of 33 kms from Lansdowne; from Kotdwar going towards Lansdowne there is a road going downwards towards Tarkeshwar temple. There are big road signage so one won't face any difficulty. In the last 6-7 kms the road going towards temple is narrow so one needs to be cautious while driving. From parking area to temple there is a distance of about 400 meters on stairs and plain. This lord Shiva temple is ages old. The place around temple is quite big. and there are tall trees of Chinar and Pine all around which really makes this place awesome like a picnic spot. I would rather recommend to reach there by 11 am and spend a few hours exploring and enjoying this place; 1-2 hammock are also there for chidlren. Nearby parking area there are a two shops selling worship items. Pls beware of monkeys all around in this place. This temple has a dharamshala (lodge) for pilgrims.

title: Mahadev temple
review: Peaceful place surrounds with tall trees of Deodar........ chants of bells gives peace in mind & positive vibes.

title: Unarguably the best place to visit in Lansdowne
review: Quick Facts & Tips:

title: famous temple
review: The way to the temple is through the market.Very popular with the locals and army people.A visit to the temple is must.

title: Serene
review: Very calm and peaceful place.

title: Tranquil !
review: The best place if visiting Lansdown , so serene and calm. The place if amazing. Cool breeze , huge trees , temple is nice. Should spend atleast 4-5 hours here.

title: Good Place
review: It is far from Lansdowne but a must visit Place. Way to Temple is 33 km stretch and is very curvy and Hilly area. I suggest you to leave by 1 PM to go and come back to you hotel safely

title: Awesome experience !!
review: This is one of the most beautiful location and temple in India.

title: Spiritual
review: The temple between the deodhar trees & extremely beautiful.quite.

title: Serene Temple..!!!
review: very nicely situated Temple, very peace, can sit there for hours..it is 34 Km away from Lansdowne, nice road, 5 km patch little bad...

title: Amazing experience
review: Amazingly beautiful, so peaceful, so calm, so green. A beauty protected by hills and trees all around.

title: Temple among the woods.
review: If you ever felt like exploring a temple in the woods then you have just located one. This place is well placed, far away from all commotion. It is surrounded by thick forests of pine and cedar which gives a vibrant feeling altogether.

title: Deep Divine
review: This amazing temple should be on your must to do list of you are visiting Lansdowne. As mentioned in multiple reviews, this amazing temple is located on around 75 minutes drive from Lansdowne. Much of the drive is smooth with intermittent bad patches. Once you reach the temple, you will be welcomed with deep dive in nature's lap. Whole temple is surrounded by tall trees and passage is filled by ringing bells.

title: Its a great relaxing place
review: it is a awesome palace with great scenic view, peaceful , cool and quite. huge open space for the kids to play

title: A peaceful spiritual odyssey
review: The best part of this temple is the drive from Lansdowne.. close to 40 kms on a virgin mountain road with beautiful views... the temple is in a clearing surrounded by Deodar trees and the best part is the sheer silence one experiences while being there.

title: Om Tadkeshwaraye Namah
review: Tadkeshwar Mahadev temple is at the distance of about 40 KM from the main city. If you are a experienced driver you can drive through easily for new learners plz don't try this road. But the temple is located inside the forest, I visited on 16 april 16 at 8am. The place was quite, beautiful and full of long devdar trees..from main gate to temple you have to walk at least for 15 minutes bit it was quite amazing.

title: Serene
review: This temple is around 35 kms from Kasang regency with narrow & curved roads & last 5 kms were really bad but the ultimate outcome was really awesome with such a peace, serenity & stunning views all around the temple especially for photography.It a place worth to visit once if you are planning a trip to Lansdowne

title: A Quiet and Beautiful  Place in Winter .
review: The place is a hidden gem. Around 2 hrs drive from Lansdowne. Not many taxi go to this place , so have to hire your own vehicle.

title: Serene temple, beautiful drive from Lansdowne
review: This is a 1 to 2 hrs drive from Lansdowne. Very good drive with beautiful views. Must visit when in Lansdowne

title: Excellent Place
review: Peaceful, superb & Amazing..... One should definitely visit & spent whole day....if having interest to see natural beauty

title: Small temple
review: It's a small temple admist all the green pine trees. It's gives a sense of tranquility. There is also a fine tree which has a trishul types top look.

title: Must Visit !!
review: Hello All,

title: Lifetime experience
review: A must go location for nature and peace lovers. Set in the lap of mother naturs amdist pine trees the place offers devine atmosphere. Should plan to spend few hours there.

title: Must visit place around Lansdowne. Beautiful and quiet
review: This place was the best part of our entire Lansdowne trip. The place is beautiful, green and peaceful. It is a different world and you just want to spend more time there.

title: Excellent Drive but preferably go with a local taxi.
review: Hired a local cab and enjoyed the drive to the temple and back. From parking to temple a a short walk thru the hilly path but well maintained.

title: Very Calm,Peaceful and Picturesque Place
review: I have been to this beautiful temple along with my family and friends in Mar-16.This temple is around 40km from Gandhi Chowk in Lansdowne.You can share a cab(usually Tata Sumo) from Gandhi Chowk where and it will cost you less compared to if you book a cab.We paid around 1800 for to and fro when we booked the cab,which we found later that was on an expensive side.The views while going to the temple from lansdowne are awesome and takes about 1-1.5 hrs.About the temple...it is very calm and peaceful temple though there are lot of monkeys but we didn't get troubled by them.There is a lush green small land next to the temple and it is perfect for clicking pics and photographers delight.You can spend quite a good amount of time though we spend around an hour.You can also do some meditation in this calm and peaceful environment.Overall its a nice place to be there along with family.

title: Mesmerising - Must Visit
review: Great place to visit, approx 42 kms from lansdowne. last 5 km stretch of road is poorly maintained but is motorable. Drove in Santro.

title: Mesmerizing View of Nature with Lord
review: If you're Nature Lover and also wants to get holy with Lord Shiva so this is the best temple which is 1 Hour or 40 Km away from Lansdowne but if you're not interested or don't want visit to any Holy Place so please avoid like me ;)

title: Religious place 35Kms from Lansdowne
review: Mesmerizing experience once we reached over there. It was a long drive from Lansdowne and loads of natural beauty on the way.

title: Just Great  !!!!!
review: Tadkeshwar temple is great place to visit I will rate it above Lansdowne in terms of scenic beauty and peace.  We loved this place as we take Darshan of Lord Shiva a d then the whole trip was like a picnic.  We enjoyed a lot and loved every bit of moment in Tadkeshwar.

title: A must visit.
review: This temple is around 40 km from Lansdowne and drive is amazing and picturesque.  The last 5 km of drive to temple is not for faint of heart.  The temple ground is itself amzing.

title: Really calm place
review: This place you need to drive from Lansdown  its little far from there mountain terrain make it look more beautiful. when you reach the place you can see lot of devdar trees around. This place is really calm and quite. Its looks of beautiful and relaxing that cant be explain in words.

title: Tarkeshwar Temple
review: The temple is one of the very few attraction/tourist point for the a very small hill station,Lansdowne in Uttrakhand,India. This place is 32 Kms from Lansdowne. It is a typical  hill station small temple in the middle of a jungle worth visiting once. The place is full tall trees and there is lot of greenery around. Cool and calm place !

title: only one word Awesome
review: This place is really awesome. temple is totally surrounded by the deavdar trees, tranquil atmosphere to relax. must visit place

title: Pristine Temple
review: What a place..Nestled within deodhar trees. This temple is at a pristine location. About 1 hr 15 mts from lansdowne. Really enjoyed the visit here

title: Out of the world, into deep woods
review: Amazing woods, fantastic hill drive from Lansdowne, great walk into narrow lanes to Tarkeshwar mahadev for the last mile and once you reach to the shrine - you are in a heaven. The natural water reservior has sweet and cold water which is super refreshing. The nice sound of ringing small bells along the entrance and exit patch to the shrine is awesome experience.

title: A peaceful place that can be explored
review: An hours drive from Lansdowne, this place has something from everyone. It is teh only place with Deodar trees and a temple with history and significance on those who believe it.

title: Small beautiful temple with good views
review: The temple is little bit far from Lansdowne but its worth visit there. The temple is not good but the outer decoration was good. I felt little bit cold there. In the month of march its good to feel that

title: Spirituality To Life
review: This is one of those places in India that brings spirituality to life. You can live and experience a true spiritual place that is vibrating with cosmic energy. It is not easy to get to (like most such places in India), but you are rewarded with something that can only be experienced at a personal level and not describe dn words.

title: divine and beautifull
review: it is a small yet very beautiful temple of lord shiva surrounded by a fabulous location though one needs to walk a lot..but seriously its worth walking and  yes dont forget to carry a water bottle...you will feel thirsty .there is a special pine tree in the shape of trishul with symbolizes the presence of shiva.and temple is closed between 1:30-2:00pm in winters though u can spend your time in surroundings

title: A serene and spiritual spot
review: A beautiful temple located amidst deodars it's a place you must go if you are visiting Lansdowne . The tranquil really engulfs you take sime time to sit with the trees and yes you'll find monkeys

title: Nice Location
review: During my last trip to Lansdowne, I visited the Tarkeshwar Mahadev Temple, I must say that the surroundings are really great and the temple gives you so divine feeling.

title: Magnificient Views and Serene
review: This is the best attraction to visit near Lansdowne. Though the drive is approx 36 kms one side but it is worth visiting this place. The drive itself is beautiful. As soon as you reach Tarkeshwar one has to walk down for 10 mins and the walkway takes you through forest which is a nice and quiet experience. The temple has lots of bells arranged in a way so tha you can ring all of them as you walk in and out. A nice place to click some photographs. A must visit. Road is very good and drive able.

title: Amazing place
review: Amazing and peaceful place, just 30 km away from lansdowne. Natural scenic beauty. Best place in lansdowne.

title: heaven on earth...
review: Tarkeshwar Mahadev is a village 36 km from Lansdowne and at a height of 1,800 m. The place is known for its temple dedicated to Lord Shiva. Surrounded by thick forests of cedar and pine, it is an ideal place for those who seek for beauty in nature. During Shivratri, a special worship is held. The temple committee provides a dharamshala for accommodation. its a beautiful place.

title: Nice Temple
review: Tarkeshwar Mahadev Temple is around 1 km from Tip n Top, Simple and piece place if you want to go their by trekking.

title: Total peace
review: Very divine peace in long trees with GOD views and blessings holding the good fortune for everybody travelling from knot dwarf it's actually 2nd mountain from one mountain.

title: Divine with peace of Mind
review: The place is above my capacity of rating.Starting from the way ,lansdowne to tarkeshwar is heavenly.At the Temple a feeling of Complete peace take over .A place to meditate

title: Isolated place with tall trees
review: Here, you'll find a pracheen temple of Lord Shiva. It is situated amidst Tall Pine trees, extremely natural place to visit. Otherwise nothing spl about this place.

title: amidst of nature
review: Travel from lansdowne to this place is about 50 kms but worth to drive. away from crowd, just enjoy the air, keep about half day for this place. dont rush !

title: mesmerising beauty
review: i went to this temple 3 times till now and each time i go i found this more and more beautiful mesmerising and intriguing....i a place one shud definately visit if going to lansedowne,,,,,

title: great place you must go
review: This temple is around 40 Kilometer away from lansdown however if you are going lansdown and have time then must go this place.

title: Nice Temple and good view
review: This place is almost 40 km far from Lansdowne. This is Shiva temple and having a nice view of Tar forest.

title: Enjoy Nature in God's Presence
review: When in Lansdowne, one shouldn't afford to miss this pious place, scenic beauty surrounded by deodar tree, pristine and tranquil holy but secluded place to worship, meditation. Serenity of this place is lovely and charming.

title: Beautiful Temple
review: A beautiful temple .. You have to see it to believe the beauty.

title: Excellent place
review: First the enroute from Lansdowne to Tarkeshwar Mahadev Temple in itself worth going. You will enjoy the beautiful valleys. Once you reach there, walk for 10 min and you would reach the temple. Complete divine and in nature lap

title: Part of our Bike Ride- EPIC !!
review: Visit to this temple was a part of our Bike trip. It is 40 Kms from Lansdowne. This was one hell of a ride. Awesome weather, curvy roads, all around green, clouds kissing our bikes. Simply amazing. And when you reach the main temple, you get spiritual automatically. Very peaceful. Serene. The temple is surrounded by lush green forests and mountains. I got a feeling of the Hadimba Temple in Manali. Both temples have similar nature. Theres a long walking path to the main temple from main road which is very interesting. This temple is also known as "Ghanti wala mandir" as there are uncountable bels on the paths of the temple. A must visit place if you are in Lansdowne.

title: Amidst green hill
review: This will be a good excursion trip from landsdowne town. This is approximately 40 km from there and on the hills. Road condition are good and very little traffic. For most of city drivers it will be an hour's drive, with stretches of steep climbs and descent. This place is in the middle of woods, very green and quite place. This place has a small parking place but that gets filled easily. Once you park your vehicle, you have to walk to the temple in woods for approximately 1 km. One can carry own food for a small picnic, this is a nice place for picnic and day break. Not much to do here.

title: Excellent place to place to visit
review: Most quite place and nature beauty all over the place, feeling of being in nature's most splendous area

title: Heaven on Earth
review: A must visit for every traveller heading for lansdowne . Very close to Lansdowne town with an uphill ride most of the way. But worth the journey with some amazing views of the surrounding hills enroute to the temple. The temple is situated in the midst of a thick forest surrounded with tall pine trees. The main deity of Lord Shiva is quite ancient though the temple structure is quite new

title: Tarkeshwar mandir is a very beautiful place for meditation
review: Firstly when i entered in this mandir all the dvdar trees are set up around this mandir it is a very relaxing place and there is a dharamshala you can also do meditation in the mandir.

title: Excellent
review: hear the sounds of bells and see the pine trees. a little walk down from the vehicle parking. children can enjoy. the setting is wonderful.

title: Beautiful and serene
review: One of the most beautiful places of worship....long unending rows of bells and tall alpine trees. Would advise tourists and children to desist from littering the sacred place. Must visit.

title: Tarkeshwar Mahadev
review: Tarkeshwar Mahadev is a village 36 km from Lansdowne, Surrounded by thick forests of cedar and pine, it is an ideal place for those who seek for beauty in nature.

title: Divine
review: The drive to Tarkeshwar is long ( from Lansdowne). Takes about 1.5 hours but it is SO worth it. The short walk to the temple is amidst lot of green and the temple itself is nestled amidst towering  deodars. A covered walkway lined with bells leads to the temple. The pandit explains the history and legend. The space reverberates with energy and force. The silence takes you to a higher plane. A must-visit when in the area.

title: It was really good
review: I visited the temple in the dushera holidays and it was a good trip. The temple is located in the deep woods and gives a feeling of attachment with nature. The best part is that we can see a trishul forming on a tree at the entrance of the temple.

title: "Jai Tarkeshwar Mahadev"
review: One of the beautiful temple of Lord Shiva, surrounded by dense forest & pine trees. Peaceful & great place for meditation. One must go to this temple too if visiting lansdowne. The road between lansdowne & tarkeshwar mahadev is very scenic and will give you the life time experience.

title: Excellent Winding Drive
review: Excellent Half-Day Trip for those who are not affected much by motion-sickness because the Drive is quite winding and an awesome experience.

title: Worth a visit ..Enjoy the ride to the temple
review: Very small but beautiful temple , Located inside the thickly covered Pine forest. The road leading to the temple has breath-taking views from the top.

title: Must visit when in Lansdowne
review: This is a must visit, when in Lansdowne. Offers a surreal experience. The place is beyond description and the ambience of the place is something, one must experience. Reaching the place is itself an adventure.

title: Very nice location
review: This was almost an hour's drive from Lansdowne but was well worth it.

title: Really Good Temple.
review: Really good temple. Not many people so its quiet there, which is best part. Amazing view. Must Visit near Lansdowne

title: Eternal Place
review: Enjoy the serenity of the place. It is blissful and gives eternal peace. We tried to inhale oxygen as much as we could. Beware of pine trees. Do not get rubbed or touch, it can give you allergy.

title: Holy place
review: This temple is 35 km away from Lansdowne please carry your own food and water while traveling only a little shop is available over there for biscuit etc and don't forget to take blessings from mahadev

title: Must Visit
review: Lansdowne does not have many tourist spots, but if you staying for 2 days, then a ride to Tarkeshwar is must. Awesome driving experience with very well maintained roads. Last 5 km is a bit rash but still manageable. The place has a calming experience and in a thick forest. The temple itself is not too big, but the place is quite scenic. Take a halt at Tiger Cafe for snacks or lunch which is 20 km from Lansdowne.

title: Very peaceful place, a must visit!!!
review: Very peaceful place, situated within the valley. The last 5 km of the journey to this place has very narrow road and you have to really drive very carefully. But overall a wonderful experience and a must visit. From lansdowne, its about 40 km and trip to this place will take more than half a day.

title: Must visit place.
review: the road from Lansdowne to Tarkeshwar is breathtakingly beautiful. specially the last few kilometers. you can't imagine the beauty of this place unless you yourself see it. Serene atmosphere, high rising deodar trees, a small stream flowing adjacent to temple all add to the beauty of this place. the place is so densely forested with deodar tress that even in afternoon it is not so much of light in there.

title: Jai Tarakeshwar Mahadev
review: The temple is surrounded by thick blue pine/ oak trees. A serene place. About 35 km from Main Lansdowne, cross 2-3 mountains and 3-4km of tougher road but quite motarable. And then walk down the hill on a nice path. The valley is cute, small, like a cup with all four sides mountains.

title: Adventure drive
review: Excellent and adventurous drive not for the faint hearted. Temple is simple, its the natural beauty and the approach roads which made the visit worthwhile.

title: Oh of this world
review: The place is huge and it seems to be from a different world.As I saw the temple there are a lot of bells to it can have a name of Temple of bells.We reach there with our cooked food and found it a picnic kind of trip in the lap of Mother Nature.I will visit it again and recommend to all to have a visit.

title: Midst of Nature
review: The drive and the walk to the temple is very interesting.  The green cover is amazing. It is about a kilometer from the road-head on a path running through dense vegetation.

title: Awesome place full of solace
review: Visited this temple on my way to lansdowne in August 2015. Wonderful place, nature at it's best. Must visit. Driving in rainy season is bit tricky, but the roads are well maintained and very less traffic.

title: A Divine Experience Amidst Unspoiled Nature
review: A must-visit destination for all Mahadev devotees and nature lovers alike. The serenity of the place makes you connect with your inner self and you immediately feel at peace. The drive from Lansdowne to Tarkeshwar is a visual delight in itself. Many a times you will travel right through the clouds and there are several turns on the road that will make you stop and admire the lush green spread of mountains in front of you. There is only a small tea shop at the destination and it is almost a 1.5 hour drive from Lansdowne. There are not many shops en route. So, do carry some snacks with you, especially when travelling with kids. The only other travel advice...leave your gossips behind, surrender to the calmness of the place, talk less and observe more :)

title: Visit if you have time
review: Not Very Clean but a good visit. You will have a walk down from parking so better wear sport shoes or good quality sandals.

title: Awesome journey to awesome Temple
review: The journey can give you feel of adventure with narrow roads n breathtaking views of valley. You need to be careful but it is must have place. Last 5km will be the most exciting as road gets even more narrower. Shiva idol is 1500 yrs old and you can see trishul shape among devdhar tree.

title: Awe-inspiring location
review: Amazing location through winding roads up and down the hills, nestled at a great height surrounded by Deodar trees. The sound of bells ringing in the cool, mountain air echoes loud and clear from afar.

title: Himalayan Bliss
review: One of the most serene, tranquil and charged places tucked away in Himalayan forest. This is where Swami Rama attained enlightenment and the place will lift you for sure.

title: Awsum place!!!  Must visit for people wanting to actual feel the tranquality and beauty of Lansdowne
review: One should take the road trip if you want to experience and feel the natural beauty.  Its superb.. clouds will come down the mountain and on the road.... there are so many waterfall in between.... its an amazing experience ..it will leave you spellbound. its a must to visit this place. its better than landsdowne.

title: Admidst of nowhere...it has to be Lord Shiva's temple
review: I went to Lansedowne in November when I visited this awesome Lord Shiva temple. Its approximately an hour drive from Lansedowne and at the end of the route you find this pine forest. The walk through the pines is amazing and at the end you find this awesome temple. you should watch out for Monkey's as they can snatch anything from you but rest all is good. Its very calm and quiet place and a must see spot near Lansedowne

title: Must visit If visiting Lansdowne
review: Drove to this place from lansdowne. 33 KM to and fro for this location is worth. The echo of temple bells ringing makes the valleys like location magical. There are no basic amenities here hence get relieved at Tiger cafe(Only cafe on the way)before reaching here.

title: Serenity
review: Must visit at Lansdowne. The temple is situated midst of deodar trees proteccting its unique location. Makes you feel at peace

title: Peaceful
review: Journey and then the atmosphere near this temple is extremely calm and peaceful. Would recommend it to all who are fond of nature walk.

title: peaceful
review: the temple is located at a very peaceful and beautiful location. the moment one visits, it gives a lot of inner peace. must visit temple.

title: Mystic Charm . . . Shiva's abode !
review: Mystic place with Sal trees surrounding group of temples. These age old trees exist only in this area otherwise full of pine trees. The place has survived since ages. Some areas of the place keeps you completely mesmerised...like pages out of ancient mythology.

title: Nice picnic spot- Tarkeshwar Mahadev Temple- Landsdowne, Must visit place if you are around that area.
review: We were group of 6 families which visited this place. Had our food packed by the hotel- Kasang Regency (a wonderful hotel, in fact best in Landsdowne). We were there from about 10am-4pm, had a full blast, enjoyed the scenic place, the picnic, the water, the trees, the mountains, not to forget the lovely local temple- awesome place. All in all, a memorable cherished day for lifetime.  Lovely memories till this day.

title: Superb Place
review: Hello Tarkeshwar Temple is one of the most ancient temple of this area and place gives you very relaxing atmosphere.. and above all you can see Deodhar trees.

title: Mesmerizing Temple
review: The drive from Lansdowne to the temple is around 45 kms and the road and the views are fantastic. The road is very less crowded and has a few small hamlets on the way which are no obstruction at all. The   temple is tucked in the deep of forest and the descend from where you park the car is around 300 mtrs. It a serene environment and really mesmerizing. The large trees at the temple are where one of the them forms a Trishul at the top and people tie the sacred thread around the trunk for wishing.

title: Long, nice drive to a small temple
review: It is one of the my best hill station drives so far. The 35 km stretch from Fairydale Resort to Tarkeshwar temple is so full of curves, bends and turns that you are are constantly exercising your hands at the steering wheel all through. But for the last five kms, the road is pretty good.  The last 5 km was a bit adventurous owing to the narrow and pot-holed road.

title: A must visit place in Lansdowne
review: The place is very serene,  surrounded by deodar trees all around. Nature at its best, thats what it is. A normal trek of around 1 kms and you reach there. The bell path is really beautiful just right to the main entrance.

title: Beautiful place with peace at heart
review: It is a peaceful place and about 35 kms from the city. There are some stairs to it so be ready for some hard climb.

title: Must visit place if you are around Lansdowne.
review: Beautiful Deodar forest. its like 2 hrs (40Kms) drive from Lansdowne. a small temple at the center of the forest. Must visit.

title: Very Serene Place
review: The temple is majestic. It is situated in a Deodar forest 40 km from Lansdowne. The drive takes 1-1/2 hours each side, but very scenic. You may not see such beauty  on the route of any of the popular hill stations. Not many eating / snacking options though on the way, better to carry your own stuff.

title: Visit to Tarkeshwar Mahadev
review: This is a siddh peeth and is situated 35 KM from lansdowne. The location of the temple is heavenly and provides great environment for getting mental peace. If you love natural beauty and would like to spend some time in mother nature's lap then this is the right place.

title: Nice Place
review: It was very nice place. Cold water stream. All Side Jungle. and in Middle Temple of Lord Shiva. Will go there every time. I enjoyed my stay at temple. Bells Ringing.

title: Beautiful Temple with a view
review: Loved everything about this place, as if you are in the abode of shiva, m a regular visitor of this place. Must see, highly recommended.

title: Nature Gifted Beauty
review: 37 Km from Garhwali Inn Lansdowne  in deep forest filled with deodar. The place is very serene, surrounded by deodar trees all around. Nature at its best, thats what it is. A normal trek of around 600m and you reach there. The bell path is really beautiful just right to the main entrance.

title: Go there only based on your religious beliefs...
review: In the center of nature, there a "Lord Shiva Temple".

title: Long drive but worth it
review: Bells are fascinating. Takes about an 1.5 hrs to reach here from Lansdowne. The drive is a bit boring but needs concentration as the road is quite narrow.

title: Its more real than reality knocking at your face!
review: I was there this weekend( 23rd-24th May) and there is nothing like it, anywhere in the world! People say religion is important to carry on the pilgrimage, well I don't consider myself a very religious person and still temples and pilgrimages fascinate me beyond anything.

title: A must visit place
review: It is amazing that such place is not much heard of. It is in total jungle. From a distance you would not even imagine that such wide area would exist in middle of hills.

title: good very peaceful place
review: You can have look at Devdar trees which is only available at this place. Exavacation digouts can also be seen at thsi temple

title: If you are not religious person avoid the days of Mela
review: We were told the view from here is awesome. It so happened that it was the day of Mela and the whole place was littered and overcrowded. Moreover on reaching the last motorable point we realized that we have to climb down a 1 kms or so. We were too tired so gave up on the idea. However the route from Lansdowne to Tarakaeshwar was indeed beautiful and loved that.

title: Felt like heaven
review: it was as if this place is blessed, the moment we reached the feeling of divinity and peace is what we felt.

title: Beautiful place amongst the Deodars!
