review: The place is serene.The bell path is really beautiful just right to the main entrance.Loved sitting amongst the deodars! Elderly may find it challenging as the approach is a long winding path .

title: Tarkeswar Mahadev temple
review: That was a rainy day. feel was romantic. its very divine. must see if you visit lansdown. journey route is very beautiful.

title: Bells in Pine Trees
review: There are limited options for outing in Lansdowne ; that is also a advantage of this calm hill station, but one place is worth  a visit for religious minded visitors ;-Tarkeshwar Mahadev Temple,  about 32 Kms from Lansdowne , road to this place is not that good and if you travel by minibus  , you will go through a scary journey but the location is great , temple has a large number of bells and surrounded by pine trees . After reaching there it will give you soothing & calming feeling,

title: waste of time
review: The place has no sight seeing value. Its roughly 75 min drive from Lansdowne and a recommended location. Hoever, its just a temple surrounded by pine trees. The temple has no architectural value. Ok, if one digs temple visits important for their personal growth then one can go there, I guess

title: Good visit but..
review: The temple is very peaceful, surrounded by tall trees. Very clean and beautiful, with hundreds of bells. But the road to temple needs a maintainence, and no good food outlet on its way from Lansdowne is a problem too.

title: Simple mesmerizing
review: Visit the temple on a sunny day and enjoy the nature in the midst of deodars. The path leading to the temple may be too much walking for people with physical condition but the natural beauty is definitely worth the effort.

title: Very good place. Scenic beauty.
review: The place is around 30 Kms from Lansdowne , but time to travel will be much as the road is narrow. Self Drive possible , but has to be careful. Time to reach will be approx. 2 hours from Lansdowne.

title: Beautiful...
review: Around an hours drive from Lansdowne (30-35kms) but a must visit place in case looking for a serene and tranquil place.

title: For whom the bells chime
review: We were curious to visit the temple due to the presence of hundreds of bells. It is about 38 kms. From Lansdowne but took us 1.5 hours to reach due to the narrow and winding roads. The last 5.5 km stretch is perhaps the worst with just one lane. God forbid if another vehicle comes from the opposite direction! From the temple parking to the temple, it is a descent of about 10 minutes. Coming back the same way can become tiring for old and unfit people, and can take 20 minutes or more.

title: Excellent
review: Must visit place. Beautiful temple and very beautiful surroundings. 1500 year old temple. Located between mountains and peaceful place for meditation and pass time.

title: Good place.
review: Good place to visit. but it was around 50 Km from Lansdowne.around 3 hours will take to go But Place was very good.

title: Toooo Beautiful...
review: Cannot even imagine the beauty... No traffic, no horns.. Deodar Trees and shanti... Just awesome.. Route to this temple is bit hilly but worth going..

title: the beauty of holy place
review: The Temple is Near by 5 Kms from My place , the Lovely and Silent Place ,The  Lord Shiv Temple ,cant explaiin the beauty of this place and Beauty of Garhwal,

title: Temple tour
review: This is something that didn't quite gel with the trip that we had perhaps because we were not in the frame of mind

title: Her Her Mahadev
review: everything was just wonderful. Words are not enough to explain...one must experience divine darshan of Tarkeshewar Temple of Lord Shiva. I truly feel that this visit was a God's blessing as well as a gift. I would visit the place again and would recommend it to all my friends. A WOW EXPERIENCE indeed. HER HER MAHADEV

title: Must Visit
review: Awesome place with natural beauty and peace. Must visit place for everyone visiting lansdowne or nearby. Also don't miss to watch the tree having the Trishul shape at the top visible when you enter the temple premises.

title: Half Moon Shaped valley filled with Deodars..
review: A short distance (2-3 hours) from Kotdwara is Tarkeshwar Mahadev Temple. It is situated in a half moon shaped valley, filled with deodars ( no deodars in surrounding areas except in this valley) & rhodendrons enroute. You will not believe it till you see it. A very quiet & serene place.. associated with many legends.... Just sit n relax... hear the music of the wind passing through the tall trees and see the birds chirping happily. A unique place, one can easily do it in a day from Kotdwara or Lansdowne

title: the scenic and silent beauty surrounding the temple itself serves the purpose of meditation
review: There is no dislikes particularly in the hills and mountains which are a source of natural beauty.   I have seen many temples throughout India but the spiritual and mental peace are felt in this place only.   Moreover, zero pollution and zero noise the main attraction here.

title: Just enjoy the nature
review: Till the last meter, could not see where the temple was. Place is extremely good, beautiful. Need to walk a lot and steep climb.

title: Beautiful temple in the forest
review: Tarakeswar temple is 40 kms from Lansdowne. The road is good and very scary at one point  the clouds gather and visibility becomes a problem for the driver. The temple is located in a beautiful pine forest. The temple is new and does not look likr normal Shiva Temples. But the beauty of the place is excellent. Try to return during day time as the road becomes very dangerous to drive due to clouds at one point.

title: The Positivity is unreal
review: This place is a must go, the traffic is negligible, the quiet at the temple is amazing and the energy you feel there is beyond description

title: Awesome...must visit place!!
review: A must visit place if one is visiting Lansdowne...it's about 32 Kms from Lansdowne but the location of this temple having hundreds of bells is just amazing. It's surrounded by pine trees and the place is very soothing & calming and makes you feel excellent. One feels as if he/she is meditating :) I was being told that this temple is hundreds of years old and the diety there is 'kul devta' for hundreds of families in adjoining villages.

title: Nice, peaceful place
review: The location. Surrounded by pine trees. Its about 43 km from Lansdowne. Road is fine except for the last 5km which is somewhat potholed but not worse than Delhi Meerut road!

title: awesome surrounding good drive
review: awesome surrounding good drive. do viist this place its 40 kms form lansdowne . its surrounded by forest , small temple . but beautiful scenic spots

title: Remote temple from remote lansdowne !
review: Must visit if u r in lansdowne , temple is two hrs drive from there . You will enjoy the drive which is full of scenic beauty and temple is in a valley full of devdar trees , you will fall in love with nature and even can hear the wind blowing !!!

title: beautifull quiet place
review: I visited this place in nov and the drive to tarkareshwar is enjoyable with good views...temple is very beautiful with bells hanging all around it..the pine trees gives you a beautiful view of this place...it's worth going there if you visit lansdowne

title: Serene n calm...
review: Excellent place to go if you are seeking some serenity and tranquility. There is a small temple amidst clearing of fir jungle in a small bowl  like valley. One can sit n meditate for hours as the only sound is of chirping of birds n temple bells.

title: Must visit
review: The temple is a bit far from lansdowne about 35 kms. But it is worth opting to visit. The location is full of tall trees and has temple in the midst of these tall trees. Full of greenery and the chilly wind makes it worth visiting.

title: Felt great to be there
review: It was a awesome visit to the Tarkeshwar Temple, it is actually situated in nature's lap. You can find devdaar trees here as they are not anywhere around this area.

title: Temple located just in the valley
review: You need to walk for 20 mins to reach the temple and the way is just awesome. You can also do a nature walk around the temple. 2 hours is enough for this place however its is not exactly in lansdowne but 50 kms away from it.

title: Serene.....serene....and  serene..... Highly recommended
review: we went there after staying  tip and top,GMVN Lansdowne... Route from Lansdowne to tarkeshwar temple is very smooth but tricky . you will enjoy if you are drivalcoholic. We enjoyed a lot on the way. Location of the temple is awesome, its a small bowl shape valley on top of the hill. I have never seen such   a beautiful devdar forest.  Just go there , walk around, visit temple . it will never let you down.

title: Greenery at its best
review: isolated place in lower himalayas, about 1.5 hrs drive from Lansdowne. in the middle of long pine trees, uncountable number of bell.  nature nature nature all you get, good place approachale with 200 mtr trek

title: So you are a rider!!! let the curves test you
review: An absolute riding delight to this temple. The curves make you think, make you fall in love and make you get lost!!! Now if you are a rider and you are brave, might as well try your skills here!! what you will get in the end is serenity, peace and awesomeness!!!! This temple is worth a visit for where it is, and for the riding or driving!!

title: Har Har Mahadev
review: If you dont visit the temple while you are in Lansdowne, you have wasted your time there

title: Awesome drive to temple and super quaint place.
review: Tarkeshwar temple is located around 35 Kms from Lansdowne and the drive to template is breathtaking with almost negligible traffic. Temple itself is located 300-400 mts down walk from the road with easy walkable trail (mini road, no potholes). Its a twin temple .. ShivJi temple and Mata temple in same vicinity.

title: Beautiful road takes you to tranquil Tarkeshwar
review: If you want to visit this place start early.The drive takes around 1hr30 minute(one-way) from Lansdowne. As the last locality being few kilometers away from the temple it is advisable that you leave the place by 330-4pm.With very few people(sometime you might be the only one to visit) thronging the place it is pristine beauty that beacons you.

title: 32 KM from Hotel
review: Hotel is 6 KMs away from Gandhi chowk market its in Jaiharikhal area to reach there one can go by shared taxi which charge Rs. 10/- per head or if you have own car then thats good. About hotel staff was polite and helpful.

title: The bells of serenity
review: The temple is around 40km from Lansdowne, takes about an hour & half to reach as the roads are narrow. The shrine lies amidst the tall pine trees. The array of small bells & chimes add to the surroundings which are brimming with piety. It’s a sight that you’ll cherish for times to come.

title: Great place!
review: Very serene and quiet. The temple is located in a great setting with tall trees all around. It is far from Lansdowne but worth the distance!

title: Recommended to make a visit
review: One day trip. 35 Kms approx. away. Winding road. Can be tiring by the time you come back. Carry your snacks and drinks. Worth a visit in the dense forests. Picturesque drive.

title: Delightful Experience
review: Monday, 10th Novemeber, I visited the place...... and I have never had such a gr8 experience.....

title: Serene and Peaceful
review: The temple is located amidst tall deodar trees and it is very peaceful there. Really enjoyed my visit.

title: A beautiful place worth visiting
review: Apart from the religious reverence accorded to this place, I was mesmerized by the natural beauty there.

title: Traquility at it's best
review: Last stretch of drive is narrow and one should be cautious.You need to walk down a km more after parking.The temple place is right down in a valley of huge long trees.its a place you won't come across easily is hill stations.spend an hour or so for feel of place.It will get to you and keep you there.

title: If you don't visit this temple, you've wasted your time in Lansdowne!
review: Tarkeshwar is one of the most picturesque temples  I have seen..it was the highlight of this trip..hidden from view, you are suddenly amazed at its location after a short trek...there is only 1 route to Tarkeshwar - Lansdowne..!! so you have to come back to Lansdowne to drive elsewhere..

title: Soothing
review: Trees were tall and gave a divine feeling. The way to the temple was very enjoying and the temple itself was beautiful. It started raining when we were there and that increased the natural beauty of the place. Highly recommended.

title: very serene
review: Must visit.  Very serene & beautiful place.

title: shiv temple
review: drive was excellent adviced to carry something to munch wont get any thing on the way, apart ffrom holly reasons beautiful place to visit

title: Meeting Mahadev nestled deep in the mountains!
review: Beautiful drive from Landsdown. Must stop at Prince Hotel, Sisaldi for a meal or a cup of tea. Staff interacts so lovingly you don't feel like strangers!

title: Must Visit....heavenly abode
review: its is situated around 40kms from lansdowne...i travelled by car... roads were scary yet adventurous...roads are in good condition but are narrow.

title: Beautiful and serene
review: It is an hour and half drive from Lansdowne but the drive itself is beautiful along with the temple. There are not many eating joints/shops on the way so you should carry whatever you may need. Please carry an umbrella also as we got to know that it can rain anytime around tarkeshwar temple. There are shops in the parking area for temple which serves tea/coffee and light snacks.The closest eating joint on the way is Tiger cafe which is approximately 7-8 Kms from temple and you get eating options there. My recommendation will be their Hot coffee and Maggi ofcourse :).

title: Temple surrounded by serene natural beauty
review: Temple is very well placed  inside deep natural beauty surrounded by  very tall trees up to around hundred feel in length. The road trip from Lansdowne to Tarkeswar temple is worth enjoying. You feel lost in the nature ...beautifull hills....passing through clouds....nice rain etc etc.

title: Must visit
review: Its a different experience a temple surrounded with tree it was jzt so beautiful.as it was raining we loved it more .. it was a lovely place if we minus the travel we have to done to reach that place ..

title: most beautifull temple I had ever seen
review: This is a most beautifull place I have ever enjoyed. Mahadev temple surronded by thousands of devdar trees, bells ringing and quite place. Must visit place.

title: Peaceful place
review: Nice place to relax and enjoy.About 35 km from Lansdowne .

title: Spiritual livelihood in the midst of serene nature
review: Awesome and breathtaking. This place is a bit deserted from the hustle bustle of the crowd. But it is probably one of the best places in Pauri Garhwal. A must visit if you happen to visit Landowne or Jim Corbett. The temple is decent looking but the attraction is the Deodar forest which engulfs the temple.

title: God is the Creator of all, Reviewing a Temple is next to impossible for human beings.
review: If one is a SHIV BHAKT,,,,,,,,,,he is bound to get peace in this Temple situated in a picturesque surrounding. Best for Meditation.

title: HAR HAR MAHADEV!!!
review: An amazing ritual site a beautiful place surrounded by deodar trees.A long walk to the temple was really beautiful.At the entrance u find a lot of bells till the temple entrance.

title: Interesting
review: A must visit, about 35kms drive from Lansdowne through nice, windy roads. A short walk down and the Tarakeshwar Temple is situated in the middle of woods.

title: Lansdowne serenity
review: Frankly speaking this place is not for people who like doing great deal of activity , this place is made for relaxing and rejuvenating the inner soul in deep deodar forest, we stayed at Anand retreat forest resort its a good place though rooms are bit damp but the resort itself has number of spots to spend time , roads are not very good so avoid rainy season

title: peaceful and spiritual
review: This temple is 35 km further away from Lansdowne. The road is good and windy. The temple is small walk from the parking area between trees. it is full of peace and tranquility.

title: Definitely worth a visit
review: Must visit. It is set amidst a beautiful deodar forest. it takes about an hour an a half to reach from main Lansdowne, but its worth it. However, it is certainly not an easy walk from the parking to the main temple, especially for older folks.

title: Challenging Drive Ends With Mesmerizing Beauty
review: It was a nice drive of some 40kms from lansdowne, road was nice and one will enjoy driving in those U bends... :)

title: Peace
review: Enjoy the serenity. Located in a beautiful place. Drive from Lansdowne to this place is very good. There are a couple of villages on the way but still don't forget to carry some snacks and water for the drive.

title: Peaceful and Beautiful
review: Tarkeshwar Mahadev Temple is a siddh peeth , dedicated to Lord Shiva. It is 38kms from Lansdowne, in the state of Uttarakhand .

title: A real beauty inside deodar trees
review: This place is 35 kms from Lansdowne and is a secluded temple in lush green forest of deodar trees.

title: tucked in the folds of nature
review: a well maintained place of worship. Takes approximately two hours to reach from Lansdowne by road.

title: Nature at its best
review: This place is a secluded temple amidst lush green forest of deodar trees. It is a truly magnificent sight to feel the calmness and enjoy nature unspoilt by any sign of urbanization here. The temple is dedicated to Lord Shiva. You have to trek for about a km to reach here from the parking. Its a must visit place for nature lovers and people who like peace.

title: Mahadev @ Tarkeshwar
review: Deep down in the hills, 35 km drive throughout tough ghat from Lansdowne will take you to a place where you find temple, beautiful nature, ashram, meditation place and most important peace of mind in the sound of bells.  Hundreds of bills are installed around the temple, so you keep praying having round of the temple.  You might probably end-up with the having your camera memory card full.  You can virtually keep clicking each & every aspect of nature & beauty in this place.  Very well maintained place.

title: Nice Drive and Beautiful Place
review: Nice Drive and Beautiful Place. Around 35 Km from the main City but the drive is pretty good except the last 5 km.

title: Awesome Place Must Visit
review: You can enjoy real Nature there. Road to approach it are clean and smooth but width is very low. So drive with own vehicle only if you are too confident for it. Very risky roads.

title: A heavenly location!
review: I am writing a review for temple but I would not talk much about the temple but the place temple is situated at because that is what mesmerized us! It is quite a drive (~36 kms) from main Lansdowne and we were not sure if it would be worth but believe me it was more than worth and the best spot in Lansdowne! No commercialization at all, go their to experience the real nature and peace with the rare Deodar trees all around you!

title: Awesome Place
review: The place is so awesome that you would want to sit there and spend time right in middle of the long trees. Seems to be right in between the jungle. The place is very peaceful and beautiful.

title: Beautiful Scenery!
review: This place is about 33 kms from Lansdowne and is a drive of about 60 mins or so. When you reach this place, there is a walk of about 10-15mins to the temple. This is absolutely serene place with superbly tall oak trees welcoming you. The trail is beautiful to the temple. However, did not enter the temple just roamed around a bit. Well its a nice place to come if you enjoy being in midst of the nature.

title: Cool place
review: The place is good. .. The road was awesome. ... driving was great ... I really loved it no traffic .. No noise ... All cool ... At the temple long pune trees ..... Really loved it

title: Tarkeshwar Mahadev Temple
review: From Lansdowne around 1 hour journey to the place, Temple area is surrounded by very tall trees, there is  one ashram for meditation and stay, behind the main temple one trishul made by tree branch is can see...............

title: Serene and Peaceful
review: A very serene place. It is 38 kms from Lansdowne and takes around 40 mins to drive. The place lives upto “journey as beautiful as destination”, the roads are scenic and beautiful, we stopped at 3-4 places to have eyeful of the nature’s beauty. The roads are shaded by tall Pine Trees and blooming trees of burunsh, beautiful maroon flower..once you reach the parking place at Tarkeshwar temple, if there is not much fog, you can see Himalayas and the landscape is unbelievable. The beautiful painting by the Master Artist. Post parking the walk to the temple is 15-20 mins, which transports you to a different place altogether, such serene hymn chanted temple and meditation center surrounded by greenery. A nature made trishul by tree branches of pine just above the temple is a divine thing. the temple is clean and free from any beggar asking for money in change of good wishes, pandits pestering you for chadhavas or Prasad sellers hovering on you. One can peacefully offer prayers, wander around in the greenery and come back feeling one with God. Overall a very very nice place and not to be missed when in Lansdowne.

title: Quite place of worship in Hilly terrain
review: Tarkeswar Mahadev Temple is about 35 kms from Lansdowne town and about 1 hr drive in the hilly terrain surrounded by pine trees .The temple is dedicated to Lord Shiva and has an ashram for meditation to achieve peace of mind.A great experience away from noisy cities. A natures Trishul,Lord Shiva's weapon made by tree branches is a treat to watch.Of course views of the hills add to its attraction

title: Temple in serene location
review: The Tarakeshwar Mahadev Temple is about 35 kms or 1 hour drive from Lansdowne. The journey is magnificent. Trees of various types line the road on either side. There is vast stretch of dense forest with lovely colourful flowers. Rhododendron trees with red /pink flowers can be seen plenty. The journey is enjoyable .The Temple location is peaceful and gives a wonderful spiritual feeling.

title: Lansdowne
review: Lansdowne is a cantonment town in Pauri Garhwal district of Uttaranchal, India.

title: Old temple in a forest area
review: Place is 42 kms away from Lansdowne. Temple is inside a forest area surrounded by very old deodar trees.

title: Quaint temple inside a jungle
review: We drove down to Tarakeswar temple yesterday from Lansdowne. It was a 1.5 hrs drive on mostly good roads amidst pristine Garhwal hills. The temple in itself is not too old, but the deity seemed to have been there for ages. The trek down to reach the temple was an awesome experience as you pass through a forest trail with soaring pine and deodar trees. Don't miss the amazing Trishul tree formation on the temple premises. Great experience for a half day trip.

title: Not to be Missed while visiting Lansdowne
review: Beautiful Beautiful place....In case u are visiting Lansdowne Don't miss this place...Total greenery...you will feel mesmerized while walking towards temple through lush green jungle.

title: A place must to visit
review: It is 40KM away from main Lansdowne town on a very cinematic nature view drive road. Once you reach to this place you will find your self in the green valley surrounded by long palm trees.

title: beauty
review: beautiful shiva temple amist devdar forest. perfect accomodation . freak out anytime at anyplace. a pure paradise one must say

title: Nothing special about the temple....The drive can be really good
review: Nothing special about the temple....Its in the midst of trees. The drive is very long from Lansdowne. One should do it if one likes long drives on mountains

title: Ancient Temple
review: Nice roads, really hillarious. 700years old temple , very peaceful. Worth visiting.Very peaceful place and to pray. spending time with family there is worth.

title: beautiful is the word
review: beautifulk lord shiva templwe ion the forests . well maintained in the pine conferred region. may shiva bless oll

title: One of the major attraction near Lansdowne
review: The huge trees surrounding the temple are a feast to one's eyes. Road leading up to the temple is not the best but if you are driving yourself, you can enjoy the greenery and nature's beauty.

title: Peace and tranquility at its best
review: A good place to be near Lansdowne. Through the drive is a mix of very good to not so good road, drive is a bit boring and monotonous. Once the Temple is reached, it is a different story. A small paved track through lush greens and deodars takes you to the Temple with bells, bells and more bells. Very scenic and quiet place to be. Do take your water to drink.

title: Beautiful Shiv temple in jungle
review: Very Holy temple in hills. Very calm & quite temple. Everything is was well organized beautiful. Jai Shiv Shanker...!!

title: Dont miss this place
review: The journey is more beautiful than the destination. The journey to this temple will give you the best view in lansdowne.

title: Tarkeshwar Mandir - Last leg of road is not safe. Site is very far off
review: I liked everything in Lansdowne. Very pleasant scenes and weather. Well Maintained. People are very cooperative. Easy to reach. Less tourists centres. It is a place where we can go for relaxation. Very calm place.

title: A serene place of worship.
review: I visited this temple with my wife while we were staying in Lansdowne. The place is a tricky drive  of almost an hour (from Bluepine resort) on the hill which takes you to this clam and beautiful place. The temple is surrounded with tall trees and the nature is just wat u can see and feel over there. The temple is beautiful and the priest also gave us the background of the temple. Overall it a much visit place in Lansdowne if you can take almost 3-4 hours from your day.

title: peace and tranquility
review: wonderful experience. Time goes still here. Do visit and have plenty time in hand..Don't come here in a rush. Wear comfortable footwear since the temple is about 1 km downhill trekking.

title: Very peaceful and serene
review: Amidst the tall Devdar trees, Tarkeshwar temple offers a very peaceful environment and is situated in a Beautiful location, 35 kms away from Lansdowne. Must visit for anyone who visits Lansdowne.

title: serene and beautiful
review: It is a very peaceful, serene and beautiful place but for reaching there (almost 40 kms) is a tough job ..if you are not used to hilly areas.

title: Har Har Mahadev
review: beautifully located mahadev temple in the hills and devdaar plantation. i loved lansdowne & tadkeshwar temple.

title: Lansdowne in lap of nature
review: Presently monson rains recieve in lansdowne, come & enjoy lush green  mountains, being a local resident i want to convey message that everything is ok in lansdowne, no road blocks, no land slides because lansdowne is situated in foot hills of the himalayas, so don't worry come & enjoy magical monson.

title: HEAVEN. A must go place
review: I liked the journey towards the Temple.

title: Beautifull serenity.
review: Liked the Trishul shaped Teak Wood tree just inching to the Temple. Route to the temple was adventures. One could take a deep breathe by looking at the surroundings. Take a walk more to the uphill behind the temple, the jungle beyond is more dense and adventurous.

title: Nature at its best....
review: One can see,smell,listen & touch Natue in Tarakeshawar Mahadev.awesome greenery,minimal human intervention & lots of peace...don't look here for luxury...you can find serenity here....only minus point is that no nearby eatry....

title: Nice Place
review: The road to Tarkeshwar from lansdowne is good but if you look down the hill then it is horrible as you are at the top of the hill. However roads are in good shape and route view is amazing.

title: Mahadev
review: The temple is located in a valley and one has to climb down a lot of stairs( and climb up while return). The area around is calm and clean

title: God's Worship
review: The temple is a specimen of local Bengali style architecture. The temple has an 'atchala' building structure with a 'natmandir' (place for offering prayers) in front. The temple premises host shrines of Kali and Lakshmi-Narayan. The temple houses a sanctum and a verandah. The verandah has three open spires with railings.

title: Simply stunning
review: This is a must visit place if visiting Lansdowne.It is around 40 kilometre away and a revered lord Shiva temple.A tree in the vicinity trifurcates into three vertical branches as if representing a trishul. The temple is in a small valley totally surrounded by tall trees. There are two ashrams/dharamshalas nearby for the pious ones to stay. This temple cannot be visited unless you hire a vehicle or have your own because of its being far and not on a regular traffic route. The visit is absolutely mesmerising.

title: Nice Temple
review: Tarkeshwar Mahadev Temple is very old temple and i really loved it, i highly recommend everyone should go and visit this temple those who are on the trip of lansdowne.

title: Nature at its best... Awsome.. Peaceful
review: If you really want to see nature visit this place. Nice Greenery. Dense forest throughout the way. Journey from lansdowne to Tarkeshwar itself was exciting. A Must visit place for the persons who are tired from regular tourist places..

title: A very quite and beautiful place
review: Tarkeshwar Mahadev Temple is dedicated to Lord Shiva. ... the view of thick blue pine forests, dense deodars and oak trees in the surroundings of this temple.

title: Great view and peaceful
review: Excellnt place to visit, very green and peaceful. I call it temple of bells, with score around it. Try to stay there for a night, you will enjoy it (we couldn't). Only temple with a tree Trishul on its top.

title: HEAVENLY PEACE.............
review: What a place, beyond imagination and beyond expectation extreme peaceful, felt god must be there...... but sorry no arrangement of washrooms etc.....and no guiding that physically chalenged or senior citizen shold not walk down its not easy to go down and climb back......take care

title: Must visit
review: The place is 1&1/2 hours from Lansdowne. The temple of lord Shiva has its own significance and imprtance for hindus. It is so serene and situated in the natural breathtaking beauty. a place woth visiting.

title: tarkeshwar temple
review: We liked the tall trees all around and the peacefulness in that area.  The bells all along the temple pathway give an experience very different from other temples.

title: Very Peaceful
review: Peaceful and Pristine with very tall trees. No tourists. Its a 10 minute trek. The road to Tarkeshwar is the best experience, well maintained and no traffic. On way to Tarkeshwar, there is an interesting turn at GPS Co-ordinates N29*48.606 E078*46.263'. That's the place I will put up my camp next time.

title: Serene atmosphere!
review: I liked every bit of it. If you are looking for quiet and peace of mind then this is the place one must visit . Feels like heaven , God's abode !

title: Awesome Place.
review: The temple is just amazing, with a great location a midst the forest. The drive is also great as you get to see some breathtaking natural views on your way.

title: Breathtaking view
review: This is one of the most peacefull place, we have ever visited. If you visit Lansdown and don't visit tarkeshwar then your trip is a waste... No activity to do there, but its naturally very very very beautiful A must visit place.

title: remote & peaceful
review: I liked it, the road to reach the place is outstanding, and in very good shape with lot of sharp turns. I enjoyed the route as i was on my mountain bike (Cannondale). To reach there from Lansdowne, you need to take 13+ kms downhill, then 22 kms of uphill(a good tuff), then 5+ km mostly downhill road. You park you vehicle and take a 200+ mtr walk on a concrete trail to reach the temple. The placeis full of long pine trees situated very closely around the main temple. The place remains cold all the time because of the trees and the location which is kind of valley. It's a good place to have picnics and spend time with family and friends. here are two places to stay (Dharamshals) as well.

title: Jai Tarkeshwar mahadev
review: U can feel positive vibrations , this place is just 25 km from Main Road in the hills , and if u r visitg at Lansdowne u should also visit there at Mahadev temple...

title: Heavenly feelings
review: It was worth travelling to Tarkeshwar temple with limited option and activate your holy feelings with super natural power at this place. It's a lord Shiva temple generated with some power from  worship of local people. Bowl shaped land scape with all natural solution to take care of basic needs.

title: Msut see
review: The travel to the temple was equally spectacular as the location of the temple itself. A must see for all, eve if it an hours drive from Lansdowne.

title: Great Place for Meditation
review: If you are looking for internal peace and want to meditate this is the place. very calm and serene place, there is an ancient Shivji temple surrounded by beautiful Pine, oak and Deodar Trees. You can stay there for maximum two days in nearby Ashram meant for Dhyan and Sadhna. One cannot miss this place on a trip to Lansdowne.

title: Beautiful journey, but too far
review: The journey between Lansdowne and Temple is very beautiful and scenic. However, it is too far and people with motion sickness can face trouble. The temple is in the middle of deodar trees and is a must visit for people visiting lansdowne.
